qas.question: In what year did the initial degrees get handed out at Notre Dame?
In what year did the original Sorin built Main Building get replaced?
Which individual began a library at Notre Dame?
In what year had the library at Notre Dame reach 10,000 books?
In what year was the library at Notre Dame started?

context: The first degrees from the college were awarded in <a0_0>1849<a0_0/>. The university was expanded with new buildings to accommodate more students and faculty. With each new president, new academic programs were offered and new buildings built to accommodate them. The original Main Building built by Sorin just after he arrived was replaced by a larger "Main Building" in <a1_0>1865<a1_0/>, which housed the university's administration, classrooms, and dormitories. Beginning in <a4_0>1873<a4_0/>, a library collection was started by <a2_0>Father Lemonnier<a2_0/>. By <a3_0>1879<a3_0/> it had grown to ten thousand volumes that were housed in the Main Building.
